questions.title: Question 4 for Class CLIMATE102_190923
questions.main: How can ensemble forecasts improve medium-range weather forecasts?
questions.answer: Ensemble forecasting is a technique based on running several forecast models (or different versions of a single model) each beginning with slightly different weather information to reflect errors in the measurements. If the different versions agree fairly well a forecaster can place a high degree of confidence in the forecast. A low degree of confidence means that the models do not agree.

questions.title: Question 5 for Class CLIMATE102_190923
questions.main: What atmospheric conditions cause the forecaster to issue a severe thunderstorm watch? What would be necessary for the same forecaster to issue a tornado warning?
questions.answer: Severe thunderstorm watch: CAPE values of 2500-3500. Tornado warning: a tornado has been spotted either visually or by Doppler radar.

questions.title: Question 6 for Class CLIMATE102_190923
questions.main: Do all accurate forecasts show skill? Explain.
questions.answer: Forecasts show skill when they are more accurate than a forecast utilizing only persistence or climatology.

questions.title: Question 8 for Class CLIMATE102_190923
questions.main: Do monthly and seasonal forecasts make specific predictions of rain or snow? Explain.
questions.answer: No. These forecasts called outlooks predict average weather conditions for a particular month or a season. These are not forecasts in the strict sense but rather an overview of how average precipitation and temperature patterns may compare with normal conditions.
